p: Chitosan is widely used as a coating agent on edible films. It has remarkable antimicrobial activity against a variety of fungi, Gram-positive, and Gram-negative bacteria [ 237]. Polyvinyl alcohol/gum arabic/chitosan (PVA/GA/CS) composite films due to their hydrophilic nature showed high degree of swelling. This can be overcome by the incorporation with EOs such as ginger and black pepper oil; with this application, swelling properties can decrease because of their high hydrophobic nature [ 238]. Similarly, chitosan films incorporated with turmeric EO also reduced film solubility and swelling. In addition to these advantages, it also showed antiaflatoxigenic activity [ 237].
